column1: Orbital cellulitis is a sudden (acute) infection of the tissues around the eye.
Orbital cellulitis is a dangerous infection, which can cause lasting problems.
The infection used to be more common in young children, under the age of 7.
The bacteria Staphylococcus aureus, Streptococcus pneumoniae, and beta-hemolytic streptococci may also cause orbital cellulitis.
Orbital cellulitis infections in children may get worse very quickly and can lead to blindness.
